Hu tugi' ini na poem para Kasiyas 2020; put hu sohyu' todus hamyu para konsigi fumino' Chamoru. Yanggen malago' hao umegga', siña hao gi Facebook –> click here (manaitai yu' gi ~45 minutes 👍🏼) — translation below poem

Fino' Chamoru

Mungnga ma’å’ñao fumino’ Chamoru,
Achokka’ ennao muna’ma’å’ñao hao.
Achokka’ hinasso-mu na mapput para hågu,
Maolekña kumekefino' ki pumåpara

Siña un tutuhun på’gu na ha’åni,
Lao maolek ha’ yanggen ti siña hao.
Siña un tutuhun hao agupa’ lokkui’,
Hasso nai, ni ngai’an gof atrasao.

Achokka' gof chaochao i hinanao-mu
Pat annåkku’ lokkui’, taiguennao para guahu.
Lao, mungnga nai chumathinassu,
Yanggen malago' hao ayuda, pues gaigi yu’.

Ya mangaigi siha lokkui’, todu manga’chong-ta;
Todu taotao guennao huyung ni’ mane’eyak.
Todu i taotao muna’lå’la’la' i fino’-ta,
Manmalago’ ham manmanayuda todus gi hinanao-ta.

Pues na’ågang i bos-mu annai ume’eyak hao,
Achokka’ na tristi pat gof yayas hao,
Sa’ anngen un usa i fino’ Chamoru,
Hågu muna’lå’la’la' i kutturå-mu

Sa’ hahasso nai…yanggen ti hita, pues håyi?

I wrote this poem for Kasiyas 2020; I wrote it to persuade people to continue learning to speak Chamoru. If you want to watch, you can on Facebook –> click here (I read at ~45 minutes 👍🏼).

I’d prefer not to translate the poem, at least not right now…I feel it takes away from the overall meaning of the poem. If you’d like a translation, get in touch! We can work through it together.
